author: Max Rego
description: Republicans in the North Carolina General Assembly proposed a new congressional map on Thursday, one that would change the makeup of Democratic Rep. Don Davis’s district.  Under the proposed map, the 1st District, represented by Davis, would include Beaufort, Craven, Carteret, Pamlico, Hyde and Dare counties. The six counties were previously part of the 3rd…
title: NC Republicans target moderate Dem’s district with new map

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Conservative pundit Megyn Kelly said Thursday she could be motivated to run for president if Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-N.Y.) made a White House bid. Laying into the progressive lawmaker Thursday on her podcast and radio show, Kelly exclaimed “eff that woman.” “If she runs for president, I might run. … I’ll find my way into…
title: Megyn Kelly says she’d run for president to stop Ocasio-Cortez

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Pundit and commentator Stephen A. Smith walked off the stage of a NewsNation town hall at the Kennedy Center Wednesday night, after expressing frustration and sympathy for a voter who told panelists during the event he was working two jobs to pay for his child’s tuition during the government shutdown. “I don’t think Washington understands…
title: Stephen A. Smith walks off stage at NewsNation town hall

author: Filip Timotija
description: There are now around 10,000 U.S. forces supporting counternarcotics operations in the Caribbean, a Pentagon official told The Hill on Thursday, a substantial military buildup as the Trump administration ramps up its campaign against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. The majority of service members in the region are based in Puerto Rico, while Marines in the…
title: 10,000 US forces now supporting counternarcotics operations in Caribbean

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker (D) and his wife, MK, reported $1.4 million in income from gambling according to a Thursday release from his campaign.  The two made more than $10.3 million in taxable income and paid $30.2 million in federal taxes and $4.5 million in state taxes, according to the release obtained by the Chicago…
title: Pritzker, wife made $1.4M on gambling last year, tax records show

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: No one is happy about the Pentagon’s new press policy.   Earlier this week, media outlets spanning the political spectrum almost universally declined to sign on to a memorandum issued by Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth that would require defense reporters to promise they will not seek to obtained unauthorized information.  “Information must be approved for…
title: New Pentagon policy is terrible — MAGA media is right to oppose it

author: Harry Murphy
description: An incident where an unauthorized user gained access to Harrisburg International Airport's public address system could have been much worse, a security expert said.
title: PA system takeover at Pennsylvania airport is ‘wake-up call,’ security expert says

author: Whitney Munro, opinion contributor
description: The Modern Worker Empowerment Act has been introduced to provide independent contractors with the freedom to pursue entrepreneurship without fear of being swept into complex and confusing regulations.
title: Congress has a chance to unshackle independent contractors

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: FBI Director Kash Patel doubled down on statements that FBI agents will receive pay following previous remarks in the Oval Office. “FBI special agents will keep getting paid, because we prioritize the people who protect this country,” Patel wrote in a statement on X on Thursday. “President Trump made sure our men and women in…
title: Patel: FBI agents will get paid during shutdown

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Maine Senate candidate Graham Platner disavowed since-deleted posts he made on Reddit years ago in which he called police officers “bastards,” described himself as a “communist” and insulted some Reddit users as “retarded,” telling CNN “that was very much me f‑‑‑ing around the internet.” “I don’t want people to see me for who I was…
title: Maine Senate candidate disavows Reddit posts as ‘me f‑‑‑ing around the internet’

author: Reps. Ben Cline, Morgan Griffith, John McGuire, Jen Kiggans, and Rob Wittman, opinion contributors
description: When the government ground to a halt two weeks ago, we felt it immediately in Virginia. But it did not happen because House Republicans failed to act — we did our job and passed a bill to fund the government. Every single Republican member of Virginia’s House delegation voted to fund the government, keep it…
title: Democrats’ government shutdown is having damaging impacts in Virginia

author: Ella Lee
description: A federal judge in Oregon has extended temporary orders blocking President Trump from deploying the National Guard to patrol Portland as the president seeks to send troops into several Democratic-led cities. U.S. District Judge Karin Immergut decided Wednesday to extend two temporary restraining orders she previously issued, which had been set to expire later this…
title: Judge extends block on National Guard deployment to Portland

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Wednesday detailed plans for an arch to be built near the Lincoln Memorial at the entrance to Washington, D.C., the latest instance of Trump’s efforts to give the capital a makeover. Trump spoke about the plans during a dinner for donors contributing to cover the cost of a planned White House ballroom.…
title: Trump makes plans for arch to be built near Lincoln Memorial as entry to DC

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Vice President Vance said on Wednesday he did not want the racist remarks in the explosive Young Republicans group chat to ruin the participants’ lives, dismissing them as “stupid” jokes made by “kids.” In an interview on “The Charlie Kirk Show” — which is now hosted by allies of the late conservative activist — the…
title: Vance on Young Republicans’ chat: ‘That’s what kids do’

author: Caroline Vakil
description: New York City mayoral candidates Zohran Mamdani (D), Curtis Sliwa (R) and Andrew Cuomo (I) are set to face off in the first of two general election debates on Thursday in the race to succeed New York City Mayor Eric Adams — the first time all three are convening after the mayor exited the race. …
title: 5 things to watch ahead of the first NYC mayoral general election debate

author: Rachel Frazin
description: Surging electricity prices have risen to the forefront of the New Jersey governor’s race — and could be a key issue in the 2026 midterms. Nationwide, power prices have risen 6.2 percent over the last year, more than doubling the 2.9 percent inflation rate overall.  In New Jersey, household electricity rates were about 22 percent higher in July than…
title: Electricity prices surge to the forefront of NJ governor’s race

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Republicans are trying to win back political momentum in the government shutdown fight from Democrats, putting their rivals on the defensive and taking solace from polls showing Americans are starting to shift more blame to Democrats for the funding stalemate. After struggling through a bad last week that highlighted their divisions on health care, Republicans…
title: GOP seeks to wrest back momentum from Democrats in shutdown fight

author: Amie Parnes
description: As Democrats look ahead to the midterms and the presidential election of 2028, one key data point has stood out about the last White House race: the number of Hispanics who stayed home, supporting neither President Trump nor former Vice President Kamala Harris.   New research from Voto Latino shows that Hispanic voters had the most…
title: Hispanic support is dropping from Trump. Will Democrats take advantage?

author: Julia Manchester
description: Virginia plays host Thursday night to a pivotal debate in the state’s attorney general race between incumbent Republican Jason Miyares and Democratic candidate Jay Jones, whose leaked texts about shooting a Republican lawmaker have jeopardized his standing in the race. Jones has apologized for the texts, sent in 2022, in which he said “three people,…
title: Leaked texts put spotlight on Virginia attorney general debate

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: A typical academic year for Mark Bray, an assistant teaching professor of history at Rutgers University, turned into a nightmare after President Trump signed an executive order to designate antifa as a terrorist group.  Soon after the order, conservative activists targeted Bray, who wrote “Antifa: The Anti-Fascist Handbook,” and he began to receive death threats.…
title: ‘The first death threat came the next day’: Antifa expert who fled to Spain talks life since Trump’s executive order
